Reviews.Content: Good value Friendly staff, good service, excellent breakfast, quiet location, about 15 minutes stroll to the centro storico. Good room (38).
Reviews.Author: BiagiodiMaratea

Reviews.Content: simpatico 2 stars it may be but the staff and the location make this hotel a really good bargain. our room was large and clean, the bathroom was well equipped and our room was cleaned daily and towels were changed daily. the continental breakfast was better than some we have had in 3 star hotels, with the coffee being especially good.on arrival we asked the receptionist to recommend restaurants in the local area and the 3 that were recommended served excellent italian food and were frequented by the locals in the area which tells you all you need to know about the quality.the hotel is a little way from the centre but the walk in is pleasant , or if you choose to take the bus the number 14 stops at the end of the road and goes past the duomo en route santa maria novella every 6 minutes.would recommend this hotel to any one seeking a quiet night, who does not mind the walk in and wants to feel part of the local scene. forgot to mention the 'cake shop' at the end of the road is hard to walk past at the end of a day spent walking round the town. great pastries and a cheeky little vino bianco to go with it.
Reviews.Author: spyglass26

Reviews.Content: Good Value, Pleasant Stay       Breakfast.
Reviews.Author: sealonsf

Reviews.Content: great croissants for breakfast Hotel Bolognavia Orcagna 50FlorenceHave just spent 2 weeks at a very pleasant (and reasonably priced for Florence) small 2* hotel, owner managed, in a quiet location easily accessible to Florence (no14 bus every 10min from 2 blocks down or nice level 20 min walk in along either bank of the Arno river ). Lift to all floors. Twin room was simply furnished, clean and of a good size, tiled floor and fully tiled en-suite, (safe deposit in room at no extra charge). No tea/coffee making but drinks available in reception 24hrs. Rooms are well serviced with double glazing and mosquito blind, TV, aircon, heater and extra blankets, phone but no internet access at present. Excellent self service continental breakfast in basement dining room with fresh rolls, croissants, cakes, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, meats etc. Hotel was popular with Italian, European and Canadian visitors while we were there. Staff were very helpful but have limited English, if you had any problem, Stefano the owner would sort it. There is a local shopping area nearby with lots of good trattorias like Di Sordo and a big Co-op.
Reviews.Author: malcolm&margaret

Reviews.Content: Value for money Hotel Bologna was perfect for what we wanted. It's a great price for what you get - it's clean, comfortable and secure. The breakfast is also pretty good (cereal, pastries, meats and fruit). I was a bit dubious of booking a 2* through Teletext, but definitely didn't need to worry. The photos on this site are pretty accurate, it's not the ritz, but if you want a cheap place to sleep at night, this is a really good option. Downers? Well you need to be prepared to walk a lot in Florence, and the hotel is an extra 15 mins walk from the main sites. That said, its a nice walk along the river, or through the student area and it's safe enough to walk around after dark (within reason!). It's also really quiet except for the odd group of students.
Reviews.Author: Devontravelbug

Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel! I am really surprised to read all these negative reviews on Hotel Bologna! Although we only stayed there for only 1 night, we really liked it. Although the street hte hotel is in feels a bit rundown etc, the actual hotel itself is beautiful. As far as accessibility, the location was excellent. About a 15 minute walk to the Leaning Tower, about 10 mins across the river to the town centre nice. The breakfast in the restaurant was really lovely - for something included in the price it was really good - lots of nice pastries, yoghurt, juices, bacon etc. The rooms were gorgeous (well, ours was, anyway!). Huge bed, enormous plasma screen TV with satellite channels, lovely bathroom, seemed very clean. It is obviously an old building that has been renovated really well. It was very quiet and we didnt get any noise in our room (2nd floor).There's a nice lounge area downstairs as well where you can wait if you're being picked up by a taxi or something... although the hotel is very close to the train station, and there is a free shuttle bus that takes you to the airport from the hotel. The hotel staff seemed quite friendly.Just a tip though... book this place online. We booked at hotels.com and paid AU$170 or so, and we found out when we got there that the standard rate for a double room was 230 euros!!! We would never pay that, personally. So try to find discounted rates online and get your money's worth.All in all, definitely recommended! We would definitely stay there again when we go back to Pisa. And Pisa is SUCH a beautiful town, we loved it :)
Reviews.Author: alanarita

Reviews.Content: Disappointment We chose this hotel thru the Internet that suited our budget and needs of our family. Although the hotel was adequate we had a bad first impression with a very rude receptionist.. Also a pendant that belonged to my daughter disappeared whilst the room was being cleaned. Speaking to other staff revealed that this was not an isolated incident. If you choose to stay at this hotel be extremly careful This experience however did'nt stop us enjoying this beautiful city.
Reviews.Author: oshio

Reviews.Content: rude receptionist Hotel a bit of a diappointment afetr staying in Florence. Our room was tiny. Anyway no prob we were warned hotels may be smaller. First floor by the way. Went for a snooze around 5pm, woke up horrendous banging noise from radiators. Receptionist very unhelpful. Eventually got moved to 3rd floor. Again tiny room with no view, just a wall. Felt pretty miserable. In the nmorning spoke to a different lady she was a lot more helpful and agreed to move us later that day. Unfortunatly it put a little downwer on the hol. Piza not great apart from tower. Florence magic as was Lucca. This site is great for forewarning unsuspecting tourists.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
